name: ITIL 4 Foundation Practice Exam - Additional Set

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes the concept of 'service consumption'?
options: The process of developing new services
The activities performed by an organization to deliver services
The activities performed by a service consumer to use services
The management of third-party service providers

questions.question: Which term is defined as 'a person who authorizes budget for service consumption'?
When applying the 'Focus on value' guiding principle, what should an organization continuously consider?
options: Who will be performing the activities
How activities contribute to value creation
Where the activities will be performed

questions.question: When applying the 'Start where you are' guiding principle, what should be done with existing services, processes, and tools?
options: Always replace them with new ones
Always keep them as they are
Measure them before deciding what to keep

questions.question: Which guiding principle suggests that visibility helps eliminate waste and creates a deeper understanding of work?
Which dimension of service management includes roles, responsibilities, and systems of authority?
Which dimension of service management ensures knowledge is available to the right people at the right time?
What happens if one dimension of service management is overlooked when designing services?
options: It will have no significant impact
Services will still be effective but more expensive
Services may not deliver expected value
The organization will need to hire more staff

questions.question: Which component of the ITIL service value system enables the creation of multiple value streams?
Which component of the service value system helps organizations incorporate feedback into improvement planning?
Which service value chain activity ensures products meet specifications and stakeholder expectations?
Which service value chain activity BEST describes user support and incident resolution?
What is the main purpose of the relationship management practice?
options: Managing contracts with external service providers
Establishing and nurturing links between the organization and its stakeholders
Handling incidents and service requests from users

questions.question: Which practice is responsible for managing risks and ensuring security compliance?
Which practice involves tracking the operational state of services and infrastructure?
What is the correct order of the first three steps in the continual improvement model?
options: Where are we now?, What is the vision?, Where do we want to be?
What is the vision?, Where are we now?, Where do we want to be?
Where do we want to be?, Where are we now?, How do we get there?
How do we get there?, Take the action, Did we get there?

questions.question: Which best describes the purpose of the deployment management practice?
options: To ensure services meet agreed specifications
To ensure services are delivered according to agreed levels
To move new or changed hardware, software, documentation to live environments
To ensure changes are properly assessed

questions.question: What is NOT typically included in problem management?
What is the primary difference between an operational level agreement (OLA) and a service level agreement (SLA)?
options: OLAs define targets between different teams within the service provider organization, while SLAs are between the service provider and external customers
OLAs are for external suppliers while SLAs are for internal teams
OLAs define the strategic goals while SLAs define operational targets
OLAs are used for critical services while SLAs are used for non-critical services

questions.question: Which statement best describes the relationship between change enablement and other practices?
options: Change enablement operates independently of other practices
Change enablement integrates with many other practices including service configuration management and release management
Change enablement only affects the infrastructure management practices
Change enablement is purely a strategic practice with no operational components
